meanings.definition: Somewhat fat in a way that is noticeable but not extreme.
meanings.sent1: She had a fattish cat that loved to nap in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The man had a fattish appearance due to his love for sweets.
meanings.sent3: The fattish squirrel struggled to fit through the narrow tree hole.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a fattish quality, warm and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The fattish clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.

meanings.definition: Having a body shape that is slightly overweight.
meanings.sent1: The dog had a fattish belly from eating too many treats.
meanings.sent2: She felt a bit fattish after indulging in a big meal.
meanings.sent3: The fattish penguin waddled clumsily on the ice.
meanings.sent4: His wallet felt fattish with all the coins he collected.
meanings.sent5: The fattish teddy bear was the perfect cuddle companion.

meanings.sent1: The fattish texture of the lotion made her skin soft.
meanings.sent2: The candle emitted a fattish aroma of vanilla and sugar.
meanings.sent3: The fattish paint dripped slowly down the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The fattish sound of the bass guitar filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The fattish feel of the fabric was cozy against her skin.
